boardgame.name: Merchant of Venus
boardgame.description: Merchant of Venus makes players take on the roles of space traders chasing wealth and fortune. Each player moves their ship through interconnected systems on a fixed map, discovering new alien worlds to trade with. As players start to make money delivering commodities, their earnings can be used to purchase equipment and construct their own infrastructure. The player who first acquires enough total value in cash and port/factory deeds wins the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game uses a basic roll-and-move mechanism for movement, but modifies it with engine ship upgrades that let the players skip certain spaces during movement. When players reach cities and spaceports, they can buy and sell commodities. Different species are randomly distributed throughout the universe at the start of the game, and players will only uncover which species lives where through exploration in the course of the game - the layout of which species lives where works to offset the rigidity of the fixed map by making different routes through the map profitable each game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The prices a player receives for selling their cargo is determined by the species that lives in the system, and what commodities a port offers for purchase is determined by a unique and dynamic supply-and-demand mechanism. With their money, players can replace their spaceships with better models, or build factories (which create better commodities) and spaceports (which speed up trading). They can also buy upgrades for their ships (like shields, lasers, or engines)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Variations included in the rulebook allow for interplayer combat and solo play, and the exact target wealth players have to acquire in order to win is decided on before each play._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 107 - Handcrafted Games (with Lincoln Damerst and Greg Wilzbach)
I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve Been Diced! episode 3: Games that stood the test of time
Low Player Count - Ep. 8 - Popular Mechanics
Show #1: Jeff and Mark_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Top Ten Games
Show #20: Phantom Leader, and Merchant of Venus
Show #25: MoV AH to FFG Deltas, and Deadlands Battle for Slaughter Gulch
The Long View: Merchant of Venus

Components are in excellent condition. Box in intact but shows some wear and the top is concave where another box was on top of it. Shipping will be actual postage cost.

Merchant of Venus from Avalon Hill. Everything is here and in nice shape, gently played. Box is a bit beat up, with some compression to the lid, wear to the edges, some dinged corners, and a bit of the picture peeling away at the bottom of the lid (where _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;Avalon_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; from _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;The Avalon Hill Game Company_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;) is printed.

98% complete. All ships, deeds, pawns, and dice are present and in very good condition. Game board is also in very good condition. Of the 394 die-cut counters, 387 are present. Three of the missing counters are blanks; the other four missing counters are one blue Rastur 70, one Qussuth Fort (with a 60 on it; red/blue), one brown Goods (Immortal Grease; there should be six of these but only five are here), and one grey/blue Demand - Finest Dust. I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t know how much the missing counters will affect game play. About half the counters (mostly the small ones) are in very nice condition, looking hardly played. The other half of the counters (mostly the larger ones) are well-played with significant wear - not unreadable, but lots of whitening at the edges. Original rules missing, but I will provide a copy. Box has moderate wear/scuffing. Box top has two split corners (upper left, lower right), and a small bump to top edge. Shipped free in the US via UPS Ground or Priority Mail depending on where you live (I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m more likely to use UPS the closer you are to Boston). Will ship internationally, but it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s expensive; $40 via Priority Mail International. Paypal preferred; US Postal MO also accepted.

The game is no longer in shrinkwrap, but the contents are unpunched and unplayed. Everything is in excellent condition. If you look closely at the game box, there are beginning signs of shelf wear (it has been sitting on a shelf for a number of years). Comes from non-smoking home.
Pictures available upon request.
Condition punched but maybe played once or never. Any questions just ask. Box in very good condition. Minor shelf wear not tears !

This is NOT for a copy of Merchant of Venus. This is for the counter sheet with the variant counters from The General, vol. 26, No. 1. The magazine is included. I marked this as new for the sake of the counter sheet, since it is unpunched. The magazine is very good condition, but obviously thumbed through. Variants for Merchant of Venus include: Fast Set-up rules The Lost _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Box Variable Nova Balls (who actually uses combat though?) Own Species Bonus Custom Spaceships Haggling Extra Forts Agents, Bases, 2nd Ships, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Mercenaries (Where the new counters are extremely important!) Also on the counter sheet are counters for the games Flight Leader _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Firepower. The magazine also carries articles for Dark Emperor, Dinosaurs of the Lost World, Kingmaker, Statis-Pro Football, Stellar Conquest, Kremlin, Advanced Civilization, and ASL. and for ASL completest in you there two scenarios: Scenario P: The Road to Wiltz Scenario O: The St. Goar Assault

Hopefully it can find a better home.

This is the first edition and probably one of the oldest games in my collection. I have not been playing this for a very long time due to all the new games that have been coming out over the last years. It is complete but has seen heavy play. It is fair to say that it is in acceptable to good condition (depending on the parts you are looking at). Item can be shipped to Switzerland (from within Switzerland) or to any other European country.
